page.title: 03Historic Buildings(2)
page.content:
{ {SHIBDEN HALL}is a timbered house with a 19th century tower.In the 15th century all the houses were built of oak.The roof was covered with stone slates and moss packed into the joints.The moss soaked up the rainwater like a sponge and expanded to make the roof watertight.
In{THE BOROUGH MARKET}there is a plaque made of marble stating that the building was constructed between 6th October 1892 and July 1896.The Duke and Duchess of York opened it on July 25th 1896.The market is open 6 days a week from 9am till 5.30pm.
